item.question: After downloading OpenKore/VisualKore, you want to start some configuration but you don't know how. What do you do FIRST?
item.answer: Go to the forum and ask right away.
Search the manual, search the FAQ, search the forum and search the website.
Go to the IRC channel and ask.
Send the moderators a private message.

item.question: It's your first time to use Openkore and you need a config ASAP. What should you do?
item.answer: Go to the forum and ask for a config.
Go to the IRC channel and ask if someone can send you a config.
Read the manual, search the FAQ, search the forum, and then create your own config.
Send a private message to everyone.

item.question: If you created a new topic and it was moved to the Trashcan, you would:
item.answer: Send a private message to the moderators and complain why it was moved.
Post the same topic again.
Post your question on someone else's thread.
Read the rules again to see if you made a violation and try not to do it again.

item.question: After you read the manual, and searched the FAQ and the forum, you are still having problems with Openkore/VisualKore. In which of the following forum sections would you ask for help?
item.answer: Openkore & VisualKore Support
Frequently Asked Questions
Discussion
Botting Tips & Tricks

item.question: Which of the following does Openkore support?
item.answer: Kill stealing
Looting
Item/zenny duplication
None of the above

item.question: When you ask the forum and someone gave you an answer that didn't solve your problem, what would you do?
item.answer: Tell the person how you tried the suggestion and how/why it didn't work.
Tell the person to not bother replying because he/she is a n00b.
Laugh at the person.

item.question: If you read a topic in the forum asking for help and you don't know the answer, what would you do?
item.answer: Pretend you know something and answer the topic.
Ignore the topic and only reply if you have useful suggestions.
Reply to the topic and say "I don't know".
Laugh at the person.

item.question: You want to ask a question in the forum. Which of the following set of additional information is best included in your post?
item.answer: Openkore version, RO server, and the name of your Lunatic pet.
Your whole config, Openkore version, and RO server.
A snippet of your config, what you have done so far, and your e-mail address.
What you have done so far, a snippet of your config, Openkore version and RO server.

item.question: When you first visited a forum section, what would you do FIRST?
item.answer: Read the hot topics right away.
Read the Announcement and pinned ("Please Read") topics.
Post a new topic to say "Hi!".

item.question: If you have configured Openkore/Visualkore to automatically use Red Potions but it didn't work the way you want it to. What would be the best topic title for your question?
item.answer: "Pleeaase help!!!"
"Unable to use potions... WTF? Give me answer please"
"Red Potions config doesn't work as I intended (version 1.6.6)"
"Please look here!"

item.question: While reading the forum, you encountered a term that you don't know (for instance, the word "SVN"). What would you do FIRST?
item.answer: Search the OpenKore website, search the FAQ and search the forum for answers.
Post a new thread named "Help mee!!!"
Post a new thread named "What is SVN?"
Send a private message to the moderators.

item.question: OpenKore suddenly stops working on your server because of a recent server update. What would you do FIRST?
item.answer: Post a new thread called "OMG bot doesn't work!"
Send a private message to the moderators, asking what's going on.
Go to the IRC channel, and say that the bot doesn't work.
Post a new thread called "Wah botting doesnt work we're doomed!"
Browse the forum and see whether there's already an announcement about the problem.
